exam_format: Industrial safety procedures, hazard prevention, first aid, emergency plans, occupational safety

exam_format: Universal Declaration of Human Rights, civil and political rights, equality and non-discrimination, freedom of expression, economic and social rights
subject: human rights

exam_format: Limits and continuity with graphical and algebraic understanding; Derivatives of polynomial, trigonometric, and exponential functions with applications in motion and rates of change; Techniques of differentiation including product, quotient, and chain rules; Curve sketching using first and second derivatives; Applications of derivatives such as optimization and related rates; Integration as the inverse process of differentiation with area under curve interpretations; Definite and indefinite integrals with substitution techniques; Applications of integration in calculating area, volume (disk and shell method), and accumulated change
subject: calculus & integration

exam_format: Displacement, velocity, and acceleration in 1D and 2D motion;Newton's three laws with practical applications like friction and tension; Conservation of energy with calculations involving kinetic and potential energy; Impulse and momentum in collisions; Rotational motion with torque, angular velocity, and moment of inertia; Newton’s Law of Gravitation and orbital motion; Electric field, force, and potential around point charges; Ohm’s Law, series and parallel circuits, and power in electric circuits; Properties of mechanical waves including frequency, wavelength, and interference; Nature and behavior of sound including Doppler effect; Basic optics including reflection, refraction, lenses, and mirrors; Introduction to temperature, heat transfer methods, and specific heat in thermodynamics
subject: physics

exam_format: Atomic structure including protons, neutrons, electrons, and isotopes; Periodic table trends such as electronegativity, atomic radius, and ionization energy; Chemical bonding including ionic, covalent, and metallic bonds; Stoichiometry and balancing chemical equations; States of matter and gas laws including Boyle’s and Charles’s law; Solutions and concentration calculations (molarity, dilution); Acids, bases, and pH scale with neutralization reactions; Thermochemistry including enthalpy, calorimetry, and heat transfer; Chemical kinetics and factors affecting reaction rates; Chemical equilibrium and Le Chatelier’s principle
subject: chemistry

exam_format: Types of data: qualitative vs. quantitative, discrete vs. continuous; Descriptive statistics including mean, median, mode, range, and standard deviation; Data visualization: bar graphs, histograms, pie charts, box plots; Probability concepts and basic rules; Probability distributions including binomial and normal distributions; Sampling methods and bias in data collection; Central limit theorem and its implications; Confidence intervals for population parameters; Hypothesis testing with p-values and significance levels; Correlation and linear regression analysis
subject: statistics

exam_format: Techniques of integration including integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, and partial fractions; Improper integrals and convergence tests; Parametric equations and polar coordinates with area and arc length calculations; Sequences and series including geometric, harmonic, and power series; Convergence tests such as the ratio and root test; Taylor and Maclaurin series with approximation applications; Applications of integration in physics and engineering including center of mass and moments of inertia
subject: calculus & integration 2

exam_format: Basic arithmetic operations including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of whole numbers and decimals; Fractions and mixed numbers with simplification and operations; Factors, multiples, prime numbers, and divisibility rules; Ratios, proportions, and percent calculations; Introduction to variables and algebraic expressions; Solving simple linear equations and inequalities; Number properties such as commutative, associative, and distributive; Order of operations using PEMDAS; Basic geometry including perimeter, area, and volume; Introduction to data, graphs, and simple probability
subject: Basic concepts in mathematics
